text.p: These are the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot newspapers on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Early general elections in Greece following Greek Prime Minister Costas Simitis suggestion.
-President Clerides suggested to U.N. secretary-general's resident representative to Cyprus Gustave Feissel that nothing must be decided under pressure and before the Greek elections.
-Ideas for improvements in the Cyprus Election Law and proceedures.
-Government backs Committee for Missiong Persons after an Amnesty International report called for a more effective replacement.
-Cyprus Airways unions have "frozen" their activities. They fear that the airline will have some of its planes grounded and a number of its employees laid off.
-Government is considering the need for an increase in the defence levy following a report from Defence Minister Costas Eliades.
